channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drug suppliers on Hackney Downs, 15th August
item.description:
Since the coffee truck was removed in Hackney Downs, drug dealing and anti social behaviour has increased and is impossible to ignore. The park feels unsafe and other women have told me they feel the same. Children will be walking through the park soon .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powell Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Messy tree pit, 15th August
item.description:
Please can highways reconstruct the tree pit outside 32 St James Avenue so that a new tree can be planted. There are several other tree pits on the road that also need reconstructing but my apologies, I donâ€™t have the exact house numbers. The footway has been messy for over a year so would be good to get it tidied, many thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St James's Avenue, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 15th August
item.description:
Dog owner and his dog pass by every morning just after 04:50 and foul outside the house. The area needs sanitising to try and stop the same dog from fouling in the same area. This has been here since yesterday increasing flies with hot weather

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenarm Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Displaced rubbish, 15th August
item.description:
The rubbish bins at 49 Rutherglen Road are continuously being left out on the street rather than put in respective wheelie bins. There have been foxes attacking the bins and displacing the rubbish along the street and roads. In the current heat, it has attracted flies and maybe rodents. This is a continued problem even though the student occupants have been spoken to.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutherglen Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grease outside Rio's peri peri, 15th August
item.description:
It would appear the chicken shop has thrown a load of oil which has solidified outside Thier shop at 112 Lisson Grove. Could this please be addressed by Environmental health and street cleansing as this could be a slip trip hazard and also not correct protocols for disposing of oil/grease. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Broadley Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
